summary: The document is a classified dispatch related to the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992, focusing on operational strategies for intelligence gathering within the civil rights movement. It highlights RODIGAST's contacts and proposes collaboration with key figures such as Carlene Hatcher Polite, Smily Moore, and Julia Herve’ to investigate foreign exploitation of the movement. Additionally, it provides detailed biographical information on Carlene Polite, emphasizing her activism and artistic background.
key_findings: The document is part of the records released under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992.
It outlines operational strategies for engaging with civil rights movement figures to gather intelligence on foreign exploitation.
RODIGAST is noted for having established valuable contacts within the movement.
Includes comprehensive biographical details on Carlene Hatcher Polite, showcasing her activism and arts background.
keywords: President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992
